ORDER, that by 9/5/03 plaintiffs' counsel shall file a proposed motion pursuant to FRCP 4(f) seeking permission to serve by alternativemeans any dfts who cannot be persoanlly served . ( signed by Magistrate Judge Frank Maas ); Copies sent by chambers. (dle) Modified on 3/15/2004 (mj, ). (Entered: 08/28/2003)

Memo-Endorsement on letter addressed to Mag. Judge Maas from J. David O'Brien, dated 9/3/03. Counsel requests that the time to file the motion be adjourned to 9/15/03. This case, filed on the first anniversary of the World Trade Center tragedy, has now been pending for one full year with none of the defendants having been served. Mr. O'Brien should give serious consideration to whether a sole practitioner can feasibly take on a litigation of this size without having previously litigated another class action with this District. Certainly, his frequent requests for extensions do not bode well. The time to file the motion will be extended until 9/11/03. ( signed by Magistrate Judge Frank Maas ) (sb) Additional attachment(s) added on 3/15/2004 (mj, ). (Entered: 09/10/2003)
AFFIDAVIT OF SERVICE of summons and amended compplaint as to Islamic Emirate by mail on 9/10/03. Answer due on 9/30/03 for Islamic Emirate. (djc) Modified on 3/15/2004 (mj, ). (Entered: 09/15/2003)

NOTICE OF MOTION by Walter Tremsky, Eileen F. Colligan, Paul Quinn; for an Order pursuant to F.R.C.P. 4(f), seeking permission to serve by alternative means any defendants who cannot be personally served . Return Date not indicated. (jco) Modified on 3/15/2004 (mj, ). (Entered: 09/22/2003)

ORDER, that plaintiffs are directed to serve these four dfts (Osama Bin Laden, Saddam Hussein, the Taliban and Al Qaeda) by publication of an approved notice for six weeks in all of the following media outlets: Afghani newspapers Hewad, Anis, Kabul News and the Kabul Times, Pakistani newspaper Wahat and television networks Al jazeera, Turkish CNN, BBC World, ARN, and ADF, plaintiffs are directed to submit a revised proposed notice to the court within ten days; the approved notice must be published or televised in each media outlet at least five times per week and the notice must be given in the principal language employed by each outlet; following the six week publication period, proof of service is to be filed within ten days with the Clerk of the court Plaintiffs' application to serve 100 additional defendants by publication is denied the court will hold a further conference in this matter on 11/21/03 at 11:00 a.m. in courtroom 11C . ( signed by Magistrate Judge Frank Maas ); Copies sent by chambers. (dle) Modified on 3/15/2004 (mj, ). (Entered: 11/14/2003)

MOTION pursuant to Rule 4(f) seeking an alternative mean to personally serve, namely: Osama Bin Laden, Al Queda (sued herein as Al Quida/Islamic Army), The Taliban and Saddam Hussein. Document filed by Walter Tremsky. Return Date set for 12/1/2003 before Judge George B. Daniels. Received in night deposit box on 12/1/03 at 11:09 p.m.(db, ) Modified on 3/15/2004 (mj, ). (Entered: 12/28/2003)

ORDER ENDORSED on 14 Motion to Serve filed by Walter Tremsky, Eileen F. Colligan, Paul Quinn. The form of notice set forth on this motion is approved and is to be served in the manner specified on 11/11/03 order. (Signed by Judge Frank Maas on 12/3/03) (sb, ) Modified on 3/15/2004 (mj, ). (Entered: 12/15/2003)

CERTIFIED TRUE COPY OF CONDITIONAL MDL TRANSFER IN ORDER FROM THE MDL PANEL... that pursuant to 28 U.S.C. 1407, the action(s) listed... and pending... be, and the same hereby are... with consent of that court, assigned to the Honorable George B. Daniels, for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings with the actions pending in that district... (Signed by Judge MDL Panel on 12/9/03) (jjm, ) Modified on 3/15/2004 (mj, ). (Entered: 12/19/2003)

NOTICE OF CASE REASSIGNMENT to Judge Richard C. Casey. Judge George B. Daniels no longer assigned to the case. Received from case assignments clerk 1/7/04. (jjm, ) Modified on 3/15/2004 (mj, ). (Entered: 01/07/2004)

Case Management Order No. 1 (this document relates to all actions); all attorneys who have been admitted to this Court shall complete and file a CM/ECF attorney registration form by 3/5/2004. All attorneys who wish to be admitted for purposes of this case shall send a motion to be admitted pro hac vice to John Sacco at U.S.D.C. ? S.D.N.Y., 500 Pearl Street, Room 249. In addition to the documentation required by Local Civil Rule 1.3, attorneys wishing to appear pro hac vice must also include with their motion a check for $25.00 payable to the Clerk of the Court and a completed CM/ECF attorney registration form. Pro hac vice motions should be submitted by 3/15/2004. Peter Kahn, Esq., from the law firm of Williams & Connolly, has offered to compile for the Court a list of all participating attorneys? email address. All attorneys who wish to receive a correspondence regarding this case are directed to submit their email address to Mr. Kahn via email or fax. Mr. Kahn?s fax number is (202) 434-5245 and his email address is pkahn@wc.com. If you have questions about this process, you can reach Mr. Kahn by phone at (202) 434-5045. In order to facilitate the electronic filing of motions to dismiss, the motion schedule set forth at the 3/1/2004 conference is amended as follows: moving papers shall be filed on 3/19/2004; responses shall be filed by 5/14/2004; and reply papers shall be submitted no later than 5/28/2004. Motions shall be filed electronically and need not be fully briefed when filed; however, as per Judge Casey?s individual practice rules, courtesy copies of fully briefed motions shall be filed with chambers, along with a diskette containing an electronic version of the documents. Plaintiffs may, without further leave of court, add or remove parties by supplemental pleadings as further set forth in this Order. A named defendant as to whom the complaint contains no allegations may move for a more definite statement and the motion will be granted. The following cases shall be consolidated into 03 MDL 1570: Federal Ins. Co. v. Al Qaida, 03 Civ. 6978 (RCC); Burnett v. Al Baraka Inv. And Dev. Corp., 03 Civ. 5738 (RCC); and Barrera v. Al Queda Islamic Army, 03 Civ. 7036 (RCC). The parties may move to sever these actions at the completion of discovery. (Signed by Judge Richard C. Casey on 3/3/2004) Filed in Associated Cases: 1:03-md-01570-RCC,1:02-cv-06977-RCC,1:02-cv-07300-RCC-FM,1:03-cv-05071-RCC,1:03-cv-05493-RCC, 1:03-cv-05738-RCC,1:03-cv-06978-RCC,1:03-cv-07036-RCC,1:03-cv-09848-RCC,1:03-cv-09849-RCC, 1:04-cv-01076-RCC(kkc, ) (Entered: 03/11/2004)
